discussion.content:

C Python
Snowpark API supports: Python, Scala and Java

Selected Answer: C
C. it will support Java,Python and Scala

questions.question_text:
A user needs to ingest 1 GB of data that is available in an external stage using a COPY INTO command.

How can this be done with MAXIMUM performance and the LEAST cost?

choices.C: Split the file into smaller files of 100-250 MB each, compress and ingest each of the smaller files.
choices.D: Split the file into smaller files of 100-250 MB each and ingest each of the smaller files in an uncompressed format.
choices.B: Ingest the data in an uncompressed format as a single file.
choices.A: Ingest the data in a compressed format as a single file.

questions.question_text:
A Snowflake user has two tables that contain numeric values and is trying to find out which values are present in both tables.

Which set operator should be used?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
https://docs.snowflake.com/en/sql-reference/operators-query
INTERSECT
Returns rows from one query’s result set which also appear in another query’s result set, with duplicate elimination.

questions.question_text:
A view is defined on a permanent table. A temporary table with the same name is created in the same schema as the referenced table.

What will the query from the view return?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Similar to the other table types (transient and permanent), temporary tables belong to a specified database and schema; however, because they are session-based, they aren’t bound by the same uniqueness requirements. This means you can create temporary and non-temporary tables with the same name within the same schema.
However, note that the temporary table takes precedence in the session over any other table with the same name in the same schema. 

https://docs.snowflake.com/en/user-guide/tables-temp-transient

Selected Answer: A
View contains query that references the perm table. so, when query is executed on the view, it will run the query definition on the view. So, 'A' is correct

comments.content: Sorry, B is the correct answer.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
when a view is defined on a permanent table, it continues to reference the permanent table even if a temporary table with the same name is created in the same schema

comments.content: Changing my answer to A - According to the documentation, when a view is defined on a permanent table, it continues to reference the permanent table even if a temporary table with the same name is created in the same schema. The view will not be affected by the temporary table.

choices.B: The data from the temporary table.
choices.A: The data from the permanent table.
choices.D: An error stating that the referenced object could not be uniquely identified.
choices.C: An error stating that the view could not be compiled.
